titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Faculty Committee on Receiving Oxford and Cambridge Children, Yale University, Records
Faculty Committee on Receiving Oxford and Cambridge Children, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 08:04

did.unittitle: Faculty Committee on Receiving Oxford and Cambridge Children, Yale University, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of correspondence, reports, financial papers, memoranda, sponsor forms, and case files on individual guests documenting the activities and operations of the Faculty Committee on Receiving Oxford and Cambridge Children.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. Faculty Committee on Receiving Oxford and Cambridge Children

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 6 (YRG 6), Records of Yale committees.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to Series II, III, and IV is restricted.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Faculty Committee on Receiving Oxford and Cambridge Children, Yale University, Records (RU 195). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged as follows: I. Administrative and Financial Files, 1940-1948. II. Administrative and Financial Files, 1940-1946. III. Files on Sponsors, Non-Sponsors, and English Guests, 1940-1946. IV. Case Files, 1940-1945.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The committee existed from 1940-1948 and coordinated the relocation to the United States of wives and children of Oxford and Cambridge faculty members during World War II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of correspondence, reports, financial papers, memoranda, sponsor forms, and case files on individual guests documenting the activities and operations of the Faculty Committee on Receiving Oxford and Cambridge Children.

controlaccess.subject: World War, 1939-1945 -- Children
World War, 1939-1945 -- Civilian relief
